pages.text: Arborea comes from the Upper Ediacaran, with fossils found from the Flinders Ranges, South Australia and Dengying Formation, South China. It is a leaf-like lifeform found in shallow waters and could grow up to 10 cm in height, and possibly partook in filter feeding from the surrounding water.

Arborea is unique amongst other Petalonamae in that it has a noticeable posterior and anterior, with the latter featuring the classic branching and the former being a smooth backing sheet. The generic name derives from the Latin word 'Arboreus', to mean 'tree-like'.
